name: Arroyo

name: Artemis
description: A modular vulnerability scanner that automatically detects security issues and generates human-readable reports with remediation guidance.

Using this functionality, application or container live migration, snapshots, remote debugging, and many other things are now possible.

description: AI-powered coding assistant supporting multiple models (Claude, GPT-4, Llama) with code extraction, multi-file editing, diff verification, and cost transparency.

name: matplotlib-gallery
description: This repository is a collection of different matplotlib plots in IPython notebooks that I needed for my data visualizations.

name: mc
description: GNU Midnight Commander is a visual file manager, licensed under GNU General Public License and therefore qualifies as Free Software. It's a feature rich full-screen text mode application that allows you to copy, move and delete files and whole directory trees, search for files and run commands in the subshell. Internal viewer and editor are included.

name: Mercury
description: Mercury allows you to add interactive widgets in Python notebooks, so you can share notebooks as web applications. Forget about rewriting notebooks to web frameworks just to share your results. Mercury offers a set of widgets with simple re-execution of cells.

name: mergekit
description: A toolkit for merging pre-trained language models using multiple algorithms (linear, SLERP, TIES, DARE) with out-of-core approach enabling complex merges in resource-constrained environments.

name: Mergify
description: Mergify to automate pull requests + secure the code merge using a merge queue.

name: Metaflow
description: Metaflow is a human-friendly Python/R library that helps scientists and engineers build and manage real-life data science projects.

name: Milvus
description: Milvus is an open-source vector database built to power embedding similarity search and AI applications. It makes unstructured data search more accessible and provides a consistent user experience regardless of the deployment environment. All components in Milvus are stateless to enhance elasticity and flexibility.

name: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is a flexible and scalable database software that supports transactional, searching, analytics, and mobile use cases with a common query interface and a document data model.

name: Monty
description: A minimal, secure Python interpreter written in Rust for use by AI, enabling safe execution of LLM-generated Python code with microsecond startup times and strict resource controls.

name: Muse
description: Open source, stable-diffusion production server to show how to deploy diffusion models in a real production environment with: load-balancing, gpu-inference, performance-testing, micro-services orchestration and more.

name: MySQL
description: MySQL Server, the world's most popular open source database, and MySQL Cluster, a real-time, open source transactional database.

name: nat
description: nat is an alternative of ls command line with useful info and a splash of color.

name: navi
description: navi is an interactive cheatsheet tool for the command-line.

name: nerfstudio
description: Nerfstudio provides a simple API that allows for a simplified end-to-end process of creating, training, and visualizing NeRFs

name: Newspaper3k
description: Newspaper3k: Article scraping & curation

name: ngtop
description: A CLI tool for analyzing nginx access logs with flexible filtering, grouping by URL/status/user-agent, time range queries, and SQLite storage.

name: Night Watcher
description: A web-based IP camera viewer for fast, simple streaming in any browser with support for local AI models and custom detection scripts.

name: Niquests
description: Drop-in replacement for Python Requests with HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3, WebSocket, async support, DNS-over-HTTPS, and connection multiplexing.

name: nvtop
description: AMD and NVIDIA GPUs htop like monitoring tool

name: OmniParse
description: A platform that converts unstructured data (documents, images, audio, video, web pages) into structured markdown format optimized for AI applications, running entirely locally.

name: oniguruma
description: Oniguruma is a modern and flexible regular expressions library.

name: OpenDAN
description: OpenDAN is an open source Personal AI OS , which consolidates various AI modules in one place for your personal use.

name: Opendream
description: Opendream brings much needed and familiar features, such as layering, non-destructive editing, portability, and easy-to-write extensions, to your Stable Diffusion workflows.

name: OpenObserve
description: OpenObserve is a cloud native observability platform built specifically for logs, metrics, traces and analytics designed to work at petabyte scale.

name: OSV-Scanner
description: Vulnerability scanner written in Go which uses the data provided by https://osv.dev

name: oterm
description: otem is the text-based terminal client for Ollama.

name: Overlay
description: Overlay is a browser extension that helps developers evaluate open source packages before picking them. It gathers data from various sources, such as Snyk Advisor, Debricked, Socket.dev, and Deps.dev, and displays them on the package pages of popular registries like npm, PyPI, and Go.

name: pathway
description: Pathway is an open framework for high-throughput and low-latency real-time data processing.

name: PE-bear
description: Multiplatform reversing tool for PE files providing fast and flexible analysis for malware analysts, capable of handling malformed PE files.

name: Pelikan
description: Pelikan is framework for developing cache services.

name: pgAdmin
description: pgAdmin is the most popular and feature rich Open Source administration and development platform for PostgreSQL, the most advanced Open Source database in the world.

name: pgmodeler
description: Open-source data modeling tool designed for PostgreSQL. No more typing DDL commands. Let pgModeler do the work for you!

name: PhotoFiremark
description: PhotoFiremark hides a photo in another photo

name: Piko
description: An open-source reverse proxy enabling secure connections to non-publicly routable services through outbound-only tunnels, with clustering support for fault tolerance and horizontal scaling.

name: PINCE
description: PINCE is a front-end/reverse engineering tool for the GNU Project Debugger (GDB), focused on games.

name: Pingora
description: A Rust framework for building fast, reliable and programmable networked systems, supporting HTTP 1/2, TLS, gRPC, and WebSocket proxying with customizable load balancing.

name: pip-tools
description: pip-tools ia a set of command line tools to help you keep your pip-based packages fresh, even when you've pinned them.

name: pipeless
description: Pipeless is an open-source computer vision framework to create and deploy applications without the complexity of building and maintaining multimedia pipelines.

name: pipes.sh

name: Pipet
description: A web scraping tool supporting HTML parsing via CSS selectors, JSON parsing with GJSON, JavaScript evaluation, pagination, and change monitoring with Unix pipe integration.

name: pixi
description: pixi is a cross-platform, multi-language package manager and workflow tool build on the shoulders of the conda ecosystem.

name: PL/Rust
description: PL/Rust is a loadable procedural language that enables writing PostgreSQL functions in the Rust programming language. These functions are compiled to native machine code. Unlike other procedural languages, PL/Rust functions are not interpreted.

name: Plano
description: AI-native proxy server and data plane for agentic apps with agent orchestration, model routing, OpenTelemetry tracing, and safety guardrails.

name: pls
description: pls is a pretty and powerful ls. It works in a similar way to ls, but it adds many more developer-friendly features, such as node filters, file sorting based on attributes, a details view, and more. pls is a simple tool for looking at the contents of directories and not a complete replacement for ls.

name: Pop
description: Pop allows to send emails from your terminal.

name: Portr
description: A self-hosted tunnel solution for exposing local HTTP, TCP, or WebSocket connections to the internet using SSH remote port forwarding, with admin dashboard and request inspection.

name: PostgreSQL
description: PostgreSQL is an advanced object-relational database management system that supports an extended subset of the SQL standard, including transactions, foreign keys, subqueries, triggers, user-defined types and functions.

name: Posting
description: A terminal-based HTTP client with jump mode navigation, environment variables, vim keybindings, and YAML-based request storage for version control.

name: Postman
description: Postman is an API platform for building and using APIs. Postman simplifies each step of the API lifecycle and streamlines collaboration so you can create better APIs-faster.

name: process-compose
description: Process Compose is a simple and flexible scheduler and orchestrator to manage non-containerized applications.

name: procs
description: procs is a replacement for ps written in Rust.

name: projectM

description: PuDB: a console-based visual debugger for Python.

name: pueue
description: Pueue is a command-line task management tool for sequential and parallel execution of long-running tasks.

name: Puff
description: Puff is a 'deep stack' for Python that tries to minimize the barrier between Python and Rust. It gives Rust its own layer so that developers can build tools in Rust that work together without having to re-enter Python. Puff allows developers to build runtimes using standard CPython and extend them with Rust.

name: PyApp
description: PyApp is a wrapper for Python applications that bootstrap themselves at runtime.

name: PyGWalker
description: PyGWalker: A Python Library for Exploratory Data Analysis with Visualization. Turn your pandas dataframe into a Tableau-style User Interface for visual analysis.

name: pypipe
description: pypipe is a Python command-line tool for pipeline processing.

name: PythonMonkey
description: PythonMonkey is a Mozilla SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine embedded into the Python VM, using the Python engine to provide the JS host environment.

name: q

name: qrcode-pretty

name: qsv

name: Quarkdown
description: Modern Markdown-based typesetting system compiling to print-ready books or interactive presentations with Turing-complete scripting and live preview.

name: ranger
description: ranger is a console file manager with VI key bindings

name: rapidgzip

name: RecipeUI
description: RecipeUI is the open source Postman alternative with type safety built in. Catch your API requests before they fail with TypeScript and autocomplete. Enhance your workflows with auto-generated docs and reusable API templates.

name: refurb
description: A tool for refurbishing and modernizing Python codebases.

name: Reverie
description: Reverie is a user space system-call interception framework for Linux. It can be used to intercept, modify, or elide a syscall before the kernel executes it. In essence, Reverie sits at the boundary between user space and kernel space.

name: rip
description: rip is a command-line deletion tool focused on safety, ergonomics, and performance.

name: ripgrep
description: ripgrep is a line-oriented search tool that recursively searches the current directory for a regex pattern.

name: rtx
description: rtx is a tool for managing programming language and tool versions.

name: ruff
description: An extremely fast Python linter and code formatter with 800+ built-in rules, compatible with Flake8, isort, and Black.

name: runiq
description: An efficient way to filter duplicate lines from input, à la uniq.

name: ruroco
description: A security-focused tool for remote command execution via encrypted UDP packets with AES-256-GCM encryption, replay protection, and Single Packet Authorization support.

name: rye
description: Rye is Armin's personal one-stop-shop for all his Python needs. It installs and manages Python installations, manages pyproject.toml files, installs and uninstalls dependencies, manages virtualenvs behind the scenes. It supports monorepos and global tool installations.

name: Rye
description: A comprehensive Python project and package management tool with automated installations, virtual environments, linting, and workspace support. Note: archived in favor of uv.

name: Sapling
description: A Scalable, User-Friendly Source Control System.

name: Scalene
description: Scalene: a high-performance, high-precision CPU, GPU, and memory profiler for Python.

name: scrcpy
description: An Android device mirroring and control application via USB or TCP/IP with 30-120fps display, audio forwarding, recording, and camera mirroring support.

name: ScyllaDB
description: Scylla is the real-time big data database that is API-compatible with Apache Cassandra and Amazon DynamoDB. Scylla embraces a shared-nothing approach that increases throughput and storage capacity to realize order-of-magnitude performance improvements and reduce hardware costs.

name: sd
description: sd is an intuitive find & replace CLI (sed alternative).

name: sdsl-lite
description: The Succinct Data Structure Library is a C++ 11 library that implements succinct data structures.

name: Self-Replace
description: self-replace is a crate that allows binaries to replace themselves with newer versions or to uninstall themselves. On Unix systems this is a simple feat, but on Windows a few hacks are needed which is why this crate exists.

name: semantic-grep
description: A semantic search tool that finds text using word embeddings instead of exact string matching, supporting 157+ languages via FastText models.

name: ServiceRadar

name: sig

description: Sourcegraph makes it easy to read, write, and fix code—even in big, complex codebases.

name: spacer

name: SpacetimeDB
description: SpacetimeDB as both a database and server combined into one.

name: Sparrow
description: Platform for structured data extraction from documents (PDFs, images) using ML, LLM, and Vision LLM with JSON schema validation and multiple backend support.

name: spin
description: spin is a bash utility that improves the user-experience for teams using Docker.

name: sqlectron-gui

name: SQLite
description: SQLite is a database in a single disk file.

name: sqlite-vec
description: A small and fast vector search SQLite extension supporting float, int8, and binary vectors with KNN queries, written in pure C with no dependencies.

name: sqlmap

name: StableStudio
description: StableStudio is Stability AI's official open-source variant of DreamStudio, our user interface for generative AI. It is a web-based application that allows users to create and edit generated images.

name: Stacer

name: StarbaseDB
description: An HTTP SQLite database built on Cloudflare Durable Objects with scale-to-zero architecture, WebSocket support, and automatic REST API generation.

name: starry-night
description: Syntax highlighting, like what GitHub uses to highlight code, but free and open source and JavaScript!

name: string2string
description: The string2string library is an open-source tool that offers a comprehensive suite of efficient algorithms for a broad range of string-to-string problems. It includes both traditional algorithmic solutions and recent advanced neural approaches to address various problems in pairwise string alignment, distance measurement, lexical and semantic search, and similarity analysis. Additionally, the library provides several helpful visualization tools and metrics to facilitate the interpretation and analysis of these methods.

name: Stringzilla
description: StringZilla is the Godzilla of string libraries, splitting, sorting, and shuffling large textual datasets.

name: Surya
description: Surya is a document OCR toolkit.

name: sysm
description: sysm makes your system play custom sounds when any configured system or external event happens.

description: Tabby is a self-hosted AI coding assistant. An opensource / on-prem alternative to GitHub Copilot.

name: tailspin
description: tailspin is a log file highlighter.

name: tbmk
description: tbmk is a commands bookmark for terminal.

name: tealdeer
description: tealdeer is a very fast implementation of tldr in Rust: Simplified, example based and community-driven man pages.

name: terashuf
description: terashuf shuffles multi-terabyte text files using limited memory.

name: Tesseract OCR
description: Tesseract Open Source OCR Engine.

name: Text Generation Web UI
description: A gradio web UI for running Large Language Models like LLaMA, llama.cpp, GPT-J, Pythia, OPT, and GALACTICA.

name: the-art-of-command-line
description: Master the command line, in one page

name: threestudio
description: threestudio is a unified framework for 3D content creation from text prompts, single images, and few-shot images, by lifting 2D text-to-image generation models.

name: tidy-html5
description: Tidy is the granddaddy of HTML tools, with support for modern standards.

name: tinyvector
description: tinyvector - the tiny, least-dumb, speedy vector embedding database.

name: tinyzero
description: tinyzero is an easy train AlphaZero-like agents on any environment you want!

name: Tokei
description: Tokei is a program that displays statistics about your code.

name: TokenFlow
description: TokenFlow is a framework that enables consistent video editing, using a pre-trained text-to-image diffusion model, without any further training or finetuning.

name: Toolong
description: Toolong is a terminal application to view, tail, merge, and search log files (plus JSONL).

name: trdrop
description: Estimate the "real" framerate of an uncompressed video.

name: tree
description: tere is a terminal file explorer that is faster than using cd or ls. It enables fast navigation to a folder and then prints the path to that folder on exit. tere is not a file manager and it can only be used to browse folders.

name: Treescope
description: Interactive HTML pretty-printer and N-dimensional array visualizer for machine learning research in IPython notebooks, with support for JAX, PyTorch, and NumPy.

name: trurl
description: trurl is a command line tool for URL parsing and manipulation

name: try
description: try lets you run a command and inspect its effects before changing your live system. try uses Linux's namespaces (via unshare) and the overlayfs union filesystem.

name: TurboPilot
description: TurboPilot is a self-hosted copilot clone which uses the library behind llama.cpp to run the 6 Billion Parameter Salesforce Codegen model in 4GiB of RAM. It is heavily based and inspired by on the fauxpilot project.

name: typst
description: Typst is a new markup-based typsetting system that is designed to be as powerful as LaTeX while being much easier to learn and use.

name: Ubicloud
description: Ubicloud is an open, free, and portable cloud.

description: uv ia an extremely fast Python package installer and resolver, written in Rust.

name: Vizro

name: vsd

name: Wails

name: walk
description: Walk — a terminal navigator.

name: Watcher
description: Watcher is a file system watcher that works anywhere. It is simple, efficient, dependency-free, and header-only. Watcher uses a near-zero amount of resources even when scanning millions of paths.

name: whichlang
description: This is a language detection library, aiming for both precision and performance.

name: whisper
description: whisper - Robust Speech Recognition via Large-Scale Weak Supervision.

name: Whisper Turbo
description: Whisper Turbo is a lightning-fast, cross-platform Whisper implementation, designed to run entirely client-side on your browser or electron app.

name: whisper.cpp
description: High-performance C/C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper automatic speech recognition model with zero runtime dependencies, supporting various hardware accelerations.

name: whisper.cpp-cli
description: A Python wrapper around whisper.cpp CLI that packages it into pre-built, pip-installable wheels for macOS and Linux.

name: WhisperPlus
description: WhisperPlus: Advancing Speech-to-Text Processing.

name: wonnx
description: Wonnx is a GPU-accelerated ONNX inference run-time written 100% in Rust, ready for the web.

description: A fast lightweight NLP toolkit for fuzzy deduplication, similarity computation, ranking, clustering, and semantic text splitting using token embeddings.

name: xonsh

name: xq
description: Command-line XML and HTML beautifier and content extractor.

name: xz
description: XZ Utils provide a general-purpose data-compression library plus command-line tools. The native file format is the .xz format, but also the legacy .lzma format is supported.

name: youtube-dl
description: youtube-dl - download videos from youtube.com or other video platforms.

name: yq
description: yq is a lightweight and portable command-line YAML, JSON and XML processor. yq uses jq like syntax but works with yaml files as well as json, xml, properties, csv and tsv.

name: yt-dlp
description: yt-dlp is a youtube-dl fork based on the now inactive youtube-dlc. The main focus of this project is adding new features and patches while also keeping up to date with the original project.

name: ytop
description: ytop is a TUI based system monitor, this time in Rust!

name: Zeal
description: Zeal is a simple offline documentation browser inspired by Dash.

name: Zellij
description: Zellij is a workspace aimed at developers, ops-oriented people and anyone who loves the terminal. At its core, it is a terminal multiplexer (similar to tmux and screen), but this is merely its infrastructure layer.

name: zstd
description: Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and better compression ratios.

name: μFuzzy
description: μFuzzy is a tiny, efficient, fuzzy search library designed to match a short search phrase against a large list of short-to-medium phrases. It can be used for list filtering, auto-complete, or title/name/description/filename/function searches. μFuzzy features straightforward fuzziness control, customized sorting, and a concise set of options.
